TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract Template

Docs.summary: Represents a document template.

remarks.para: The Template object is a member of the collection. The Templates collection includes all the available Template objects.
Use Templates(), where is the template name or the index number, to return a single Template object. The index number represents the position of the template in the Templates collection.
The Add method isn't available for the Templates collection. Instead, you can add a template to the Templates collection by doing any of the following:

item.para: Using the method with the collection to open a document based on a template or a template
Using the method with the Documents collection to open a new document based on a template
Using the method with the collection to load a global template
Using the property with the object to attach a template to a document

remarks.para: Use the property to return a template object that refers to the Normal template. Use the property to return the template attached to the specified document.
Use the property to return or set the location of user or workgroup templates (that is, the folder where you want to store these templates).

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Application

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the Microsoft Word application.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AutoTextEntries As AutoTextEntries

Docs.summary: Returns a collection that represents all the AutoText entries in the specified template.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property BuildingBlockEntries As BuildingBlockEntries

Docs.summary: Returns a collection that represents the collection of building block entries in a template. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property BuildingBlockTypes As BuildingBlockTypes

Docs.summary: Returns a collection that represents the collection of building block types that are contained in a template. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property BuiltInDocumentProperties As Object
public: property System::Object ^ BuiltInDocumentProperties { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a collection that represents all the built-in document properties for the specified document.

remarks.para: To return a single object that represents a specific built-in document property, use BuiltinDocumentProperties(), where is a constant.
If Microsoft Word doesn't define a value for one of the built-in document properties, reading the property for that document property generates an error.
Use the property to return the collection of custom document properties.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created.

remarks.para: If the object was created in Microsoft Word, this property returns the hexadecimal number 4D535744, which represents the string "MSWD." This value can also be represented by the constant wdCreatorCode.

The Creator property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CustomDocumentProperties As Object
public: property System::Object ^ CustomDocumentProperties { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a collection that represents all the custom document properties for the specified document.

remarks.para: Use the property to return the collection of built-in document properties.

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the East Asian language to use when breaking lines of text in the specified document or template.

remarks.para: can be one of these WdFarEastLineBreakLanguageID constants:

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the line break control level for the specified document.

remarks.para: This property is ignored if the property is set to False.
can be one of these WdFarEastLineBreakLevel constants:

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property FullName As String
public: property System::String ^ FullName { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Specifies the name of a template, including the drive or Web path.

remarks.para: Using this property is equivalent to using the , , and properties in sequence.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdJustificationMode JustificationMode { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdJustificationMode get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdJustificationMode value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the character spacing adjustment for the specified template.

remarks.para: can be one of these WdJustificationMode constants:

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool KerningByAlgorithm { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.KerningByAlgorithm : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: True if Microsoft Word kerns half-width Latin characters and punctuation marks in the specified document.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLanguageID LanguageID { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLanguageID get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLanguageID value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the language for the specified object.

remarks.para: Can be one of the constants.
Some of the WdLanguageID constants may not be available to you, depending on the language support (U.S. English, for example) that you’ve selected or installed.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLanguageID LanguageIDFarEast { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLanguageID get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLanguageID value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an East Asian language for the specified object.

remarks.para: Can be one of the constants.
This is the recommended way to return or set the language of East Asian text in a document created in an East Asian version of Microsoft Word.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ListTemplates As ListTemplates

Docs.summary: Returns a collection that represents all the list formats for the specified template.

public: property System::String ^ default { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the name of the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int NoProofing { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: True if the spelling and grammar checker ignores documents based on this template.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Document OpenAsDocument() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Opens the specified template as a document and returns a object.

remarks.para: Opening a template as a document allows the user to edit the contents of the template. This may be necessary if a property or method (the property, for example) isn't available from the object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Parent As Object
public: property System::Object ^ Parent { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents the parent object of the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Path As String
public: property System::String ^ Path { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the disk or Web path to the specified object.

remarks.para: The path doesn't include a trailing character— for example, "C:\MSOffice" or "http://MyServer". Use the property to add the character that separates folders and drive letters. Use the property to return the file name without the path and use the property to return the file name and the path together.
Note You can use the PathSeparator property to build Web addresses even though they contain forward slashes (/) and the PathSeparator property defaults to a backslash (\).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Save() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Saves the specified document or template.

remarks.para: If the document or template hasn't been saved before, the Save As dialog box prompts the user for a file name.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool Saved { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.Saved : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: True if the specified document or template hasn't changed since it was last saved. False if Microsoft Word displays a prompt to save changes when the document is closed.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Type As WdTemplateType

Docs.summary: Returns the template type.

remarks.para: can be one of these WdTemplateType constants:

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property VBProject As VBProject
public: property Microsoft::Vbe::Interop::VBProject ^ VBProject { Microsoft::Vbe::Interop::VBProject ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the VBProject object for the specified template.

remarks.para: Use this property to gain access to code modules and user forms.

To view the VBProject object in the object browser, you must select the Microsoft Visual Basic for Applications Extensibility check box in the References dialog box (Tools menu) in the Visual Basic Editor.
